page.title: 02THE RIVER MEON
page.content: The source of the River Meon is on South Farm, which is just south of East Meon. At this point the river is quite wide, but narrows as it approaches the village. The river adds greatly to the character of East Meon, as it flows straight through the centre, seeming at some points to divide the village in half. The two parts are joined by a few bridges, although for some of its journey the River Meon disappears under buildings. There are many recordings of flooding in East Meon village. It was especially bad in 1953. Therefore in 1955, some alterations were made. The river was widened and deepened. Much of its water is used by HMS Mercury & so it never flows at a very high level these days. Many people fish in the River Meon, mainly for trout.
